meanings.definition: To cause to be out of tune or harmony.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site can untune my concentration.
meanings.sent2: The musician's off-key singing can untune the entire band.
meanings.sent3: Trying to study while listening to heavy metal music can untune my focus.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in weather can untune the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent5: The barking dog next door can untune my relaxation after a long day.

meanings.definition: To disturb the normal functioning or order of.
meanings.sent1: The power outage can untune the schedule of the whole day.
meanings.sent2: Forgetting my umbrella can untune my plans for a walk in the park.
meanings.sent3: Accidentally deleting important files can untune the organization of my computer.
meanings.sent4: A sudden change in plans can untune the flow of the entire day.
meanings.sent5: Getting stuck in traffic can untune the timing of important meetings.
